heisig_story: Note the clearer outline of a triangular mountain here.
koohiiStory1: Pictograph, see book. * As a primitive this element appears equally as well at the top or bottom of the kanjis (besides appearing to the left). Since a mountain often brings to mind towering peaks, I will consider it implied that the element is placed at the top of the kanji. When this primitive appears at the bottom, I will arrange my story in a way that other elements are said to be at the very top of the mountain (see FRAME 775 for an example).

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The mountain radical and the mountain kanji are the same.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Make sure you're studying your radicals. If you are, then you're studying your kanji as well!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Think about mountains talking to each other, calling each other by their names and adding the Japanese name-ender san („Åï„Çì) to each of their names. "Hello, Everest-san." "Oh hi, Fuji-san."
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Be sure to imagine this vividly. The more absurdly you can imagine it, the more likely you are to remember the reading, san.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: (looks like) the peaks of a mountain
humanum_full_description_en:
" Mountain " oracle bone inscriptions like mountain peaks stand side by side, which is easy to confuse with " Fire ". Only the character " mountain " is mostly flat-bottomed, and the character " fire " is mostly arc-bottomed. Scholars generally distinguish between the two based on the meaning of inscriptions, see " Fire " for details. The peaks on both sides of the inscription " mountain " are not obvious. The characters of the Warring States Period are inherited from bronze inscriptions, or a vertical pen with a decorative pen in the middle of the glyph.

The word " mountain " oracle bone inscriptions is used as the original meaning for mountain interpretation. Such as "Collection" 20271: "Wangzhi Mountain." Refers to the Wang ascended the hill. " Mountain " word oracle mountain can also be used, such as "collection" 30173: "it rain in the mountains." Can also be used as a name, such as "collection" 32967: "Mountain steroid Wang Shi" " steroid " is handled meaning.

The word " mountain " in the bronze inscription is suspected to be used as the original meaning, such as Qi Zun has the word "valley". " Mountain " is also extended as a place name. The land with mountains can be called a mountain, such as Da Keding: "Yi (gi) female (ru) field is in Hanshan." It refers to the field given to you in Hanshan. In addition, the inscription " mountain " can also be used as the name of a clan or a person.

"Shuowen": "Mountain, Xuan Ye. Xuan Qi, all things are born, stone and high. Pictogram. All mountains belong to the mountain." Press "Mountain, Xuan Ye" for the sound instruction, not the interpretation of " mountain " The original meaning of the word.
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: It is like the shape of mountain peaks side by side, the original meaning is mountain.

" Mountain" oracle bone inscriptions like mountain peaks stand side by side, which is easy to confuse with " Fire". Only the character " mountain" is mostly flat-bottomed, and the character " fire" is mostly arc-bottomed. Scholars generally distinguish between the two based on the meaning of inscriptions, see " Fire" for details. The peaks on both sides of the inscription " mountain" are not obvious. The characters of the Warring States Period are inherited from bronze inscriptions, or a vertical pen with a decorative pen in the middle of the glyph. The word " mountain" oracle bone inscriptions is used as the original meaning for mountain interpretation. Such as "Collection" 20271: "Wangzhi Mountain." Refers to the Wang ascended the hill. " Mountain" word oracle mountain can also be used, such as "collection" 30173: "it rain in the mountains." Can also be used as a name, such as "collection" 32967: "Mountain steroid Wang Shi" " steroid" is handled meaning. The word " mountain" in the bronze inscription is suspected to be used as the original meaning, such as Qi Zun has the word "valley". " Mountain" is also extended as a place name. The land with mountains can be called a mountain, such as Da Keding: "Yi (gi) female (ru) field is in Hanshan." It refers to the field given to you in Hanshan. In addition, the inscription " mountain" can also be used as the name of a clan or a person. "Shuowen": "Mountain, Xuan Ye. Xuan Qi, all things are born, stone and high. Pictogram. All mountains belong to the mountain." Press "Mountain, Xuan Ye" for the sound instruction, not the interpretation of " mountain" The original meaning of the word.

mountain
Basic explanation of words
mountain
shƒÅn
The towering part formed by the ground: earth mountain. cliff. Mountains. Mountains and rivers. Mountain road. Hilltop. The scenery is beautiful. The rain is coming and the wind is all over the building (a metaphor for the tension before the conflict or war breaks out).
Shaped like a mountain: gables (the walls on both sides of a herringbone house. Also known as "Fangshan").
Describe loudly: the sound of mountains. Long live the mountain call.
name.
mountain
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]ÔºªshƒÅnÔºΩ
["Guangyun" cut freely, Hirayama, raw. ]
(1) A raised part of earth and rock on the ground.
(2) Especially referring to the Five Sacred Mountains.
(3) Something shaped like a mountain.
(4) Mausoleum, tomb.
(5) Silkworm clusters. The upper cluster of silkworms is called Shangshan. See "Up 2 Mountain".
(6) Refers to the gable.
(7) Refers to the upper floor of the wine shop.
(8) In the mountains. Refers to a place of seclusion.
(9) Mountains and villages. Used as a modest word. See "Shan Chen", "Shan Qi".
(10) Describe the loudness. See "Mountain Sounds".
(11) Last name. Jin has mountain waves. See the biography of "Book of Jin".
mountain

Radicals: Â±±  (mountain)
Meaning Mnemonic
The mountain radical and the mountain kanji are the same.
Make sure you're studying your radicals. If you are, then you're studying your kanji as well!
Reading Mnemonic
Think about mountains talking to each other, calling each other by their names and adding the Japanese name-ender san („Åï„Çì) to each of their names. "Hello, Everest-san." "Oh hi, Fuji-san."
